node.title: 'Deeply upsetting' but locals not surprised by video of drug-taking child
node.alt: Young boy smoking a bong in the Kimberley, face unrecognisable.
node.description: Escalating fears for the safety of Kimberley children are amplified by a video circulating of a child inhaling drugsÂ in the same town where alcohol sales were halted due to drunken domestic violence.
node.content:
["Emotions are running high in the Kimberley with video emerging of a young child smoking a bong while onlookers laugh.", "It comes after a Christmas marred by distressing levels of domestic violence in northern towns\u00a0which police are linking to chronic alcohol and drug abuse.", "The video appears to have been filmed in a backyard in the town of Derby\u00a0and shows the small boy sucking on a homemade bong and being encouraged by a laughing adult to blow smoke at the camera.", "Local Liberal MP Neil Thomson described\u00a0it as\u00a0a disturbing scene.", "\"The video is deeply upsetting\u00a0and we can't begin to understand the future for that young child,\" he said.", "", "
Neil Thomson says drastic action is needed to improve family life and education options for children.(Supplied)
", "\"These problems include the home environment of young people, parental responsibility, education and\u00a0housing, and we need responses that are directed towards those problems.\"", "The ABC understands child protection authorities have been made aware of the video, but it is not known what action has been taken in response.", "
Government 'isn't interested'
", "It is\u00a0the latest escalation in children being exposed to dangerous behaviour in the Kimberley.", "Community leaders hoped that the death of a 12-year-old girl in a stolen car crash in Fitzroy Crossing in July would prove a\u00a0catalyst for change, but the speeding and ram raids by children has continued.", "Mr Thomson said locals are despairing of the levels of child neglect and crime, and the WA government has an obligation to act.", "\"I think that that we need a direct response, one that requires parents to do certain things where they're being found not to be providing the right outcomes for their children.", "\"We can't dance around this issue. It requires resourcing and funding, and the empowering of our public servants and our service providers to actually deal with issues directly.\"", "", "
Kimberley communities are calling for support to run more on-country programs\u00a0to keep children occupied.(ABC Kimberley: Erin Parke\u00a0)
", "The WA government promised a juvenile drug and alcohol treatment centre would be built in the region, but it has so far failed to materialise.", "The McGowan government has so far funded only a small portion of the Kimberley Juvenile Justice Strategy pitched to cabinet by government departments last year.", "A total of $7.8 million has been allocated to programs such as night patrols, on-country mentoring, and planning for a residential detention alternative in WA's north.", "
Localised programs needed
", "Nyikina man and youth worker\u00a0Trevor Menmuir said he was appalled by the video.", "\"It's always a shock when you see something like that, with the kid being so young,\" he said.", "\"We need programs for the disengaged kids. They've missed out on so much, and they go to school and they can't engage.", "\"The option is you are either in class or you go home \u2026 so they feel that they're not part of the community.\"", "", "
The video of the child being encouraged to do drugs on camera is believed to have been filmed in the Kimberley town of Derby.(Supplied: Nick Sundblom)
", "Community calls for intervention in the Kimberley has been hampered by ministerial responsibility being split across portfolios such as child protection, community development, policing, and Aboriginal affairs.", "Minister Simone McGurk, who is\u00a0responsible for child protection, prevention of domestic violence, and community services, had not responded to requests for comment by the time of publication.", "
'It's normalised, but it's not normal'
", "Meanwhile, police in the region have described distressingly high rates of drunken violence over Christmas.", "Senior Sergeant Dave Whitnell said he felt compelled to shut down takeaway alcohol sales in the town of Derby for 24 hours to put a pause on stabbings and beatings.", "", "
Senior Sergeant Dave Whitnell says\u00a0the community has \"had a gutful\" of alcohol-driven violence as well.(ABC Kimberley: Erin Parke )
", "\"After we turned the alcohol off the hospital saw about a 75 per cent drop in presentations the next night,\" he said.", "\"Alcohol is the elephant in the room and I think the community have had a gutful as well.", "\"We see people breaking bottles and stabbing each other, we see woundings quite regularly. It's just a level of violence you just tend not to see in other parts of Western Australia.", "\"Unfortunately it's all related to excessive alcohol consumption.\""]
